intro: Juncellus ater, commonly known as the black rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Juncaceae family. It is characterized by its dense, dark green to blackish stems that are often covered in short, stiff hairs. The plant typically grows in wet or damp environments such as marshes, swamps, and along the edges of ponds. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, usually arranged in spike-like clusters. Juncellus ater plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various small aquatic and semi-aquatic organisms.
